alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin; Ochoco-John Day Highlands (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 3:28AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The remnants of Hurricane Hilary will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain to portions of northeastern Oregon Monday into Tuesday... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Oregon, including the following areas, John Day Basin and Ochoco-John Day Highlands. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...1 to 1.5 inches of rain is expected. The excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations like burn scars and areas of steep terrain. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Mainstem river flooding is not expected at this time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain is expected to begin late Sunday night and become steadier and heavier by Monday morning and continue through the day Monday before decreasing by Monday evening. Thunderstorms are also possible. Lighter rain will linger through Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: John Day Basin; Ochoco-John Day Highlands
